title: [K-12] Designing STEM Education Reform Through Teacher-Led Learning Communities

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational STEM knowledge and university-level learning experiences
context.additional_context: An experimental process for improving STEM education in a collaborative environment composed of teaching teams (co-instructors, teaching assistants, undergraduate learning assistants), integrating face-to-face and non-face-to-face activities in a blended learning environment.

learning_goals: Learners can collaborate with faculty to analyze limitations of existing STEM educational approaches and propose at least three improvement directions
Learners achieve over 80% participation in designing creative instructional methodologies through collaboration with diverse members (teaching assistants/peers)
Through reflective practice, learners enhance their educational design competencies by over 20% compared to pre-assessment levels
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
